triples.name: Time crystal
triples.relevance: The Colloquium reviews discrete time crystals as a novel phase of matter with broken time translation symmetry.

triples.name: Time-translation symmetry
triples.relevance: Breaking of time translation symmetry is the fundamental principle behind discrete time crystals.

triples.name: Ergodicity
triples.relevance: Ergodicity breaking is identified as the key to understanding discrete time crystals and related phenomena.

triples.name: Many-body problem
triples.relevance: Many-body interactions are a crucial combination factor in producing subharmonic oscillations in time crystals.

triples.name: Quantum simulator
triples.relevance: Many-body quantum simulators provide a natural platform for experimentally investigating time crystalline order.

triples.name: Trapped-ion quantum computer
triples.relevance: Trapped ions are reviewed as an experimental platform for observing signatures of time crystalline order.

triples.name: Superconducting quantum computing
triples.relevance: Superconducting qubits are reviewed as an experimental platform for demonstrating time crystalline phenomena.

triples.name: Josephson effect
triples.relevance: The AC Josephson effect is discussed as a related phenomenon sharing properties with discrete time crystals.

triples.name: Coupled map lattice
triples.relevance: Coupled map lattices are mentioned as phenomena sharing properties with discrete time crystals.

triples.name: Faraday wave
triples.relevance: Faraday waves are discussed as a classical system exhibiting subharmonic oscillations similar to time crystals.

triples.name: Anderson localization
triples.relevance: Localization is identified as a key theoretical strategy for stabilizing time crystalline order in closed systems.

triples.name: Eigenstate thermalization hypothesis
triples.relevance: Prethermalization relates to delayed thermalization processes that are central to understanding time crystal dynamics.

triples.name: Quantum error correction
triples.relevance: Error correction is discussed as a theoretical strategy for stabilizing time crystalline order in open quantum systems.
